bibl.title: M. McMillan Eral v. The United States of America. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

body.p: United States of America } SS. Territory of Washington Third Judicial District
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle
The United States of America } 4901 vs. M. McMillan Eral
Comes now W.H. White. United States attorney for Washington Territory and petitions the above court and represents as follows
That L.L. Bales and J.M. Montgomery are material and necessary witnesses on the part of the United States in nthe above entitled cause.
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus at testificandum may issue out of the above court

to T.J. Hamilton United States Marshal for Washington Territory commanding him that he has paid L.L. Bales and J. M. Montgomery in court here on Monday September 13th 1886 at 10 o'clock a.m. or as soon there after as said writ can be returned then and there to give testimony in the above styled cause. and that upon the completion of their testimony the be returned to said U.S. Penitentiary at McNeil's Island.
and your petitioner will even pray Dated at Seattle this 11th day of September 1886
W.H. White United States Attorney for Washington Territory
No. 4901 5004 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle Washington Territory
United States Plaintiff vs. M. McMillan Eral Defendants
Petition for writ of Habeas Corpus at testificandum
WHITE & W.H. White U.S. attorney for W.T.
